translation: The Blessed Lord said, "Undoubtedly, O mighty-armed Arjuna, the mind is difficult to control and restless; but with practice and dispassion, it can be restrained."
commentary: 6.35 Undoubtedly undoubtedly? Mighty-armed O mightyarmed? The mind the mind? Durnigraham difficult to control? Chalam restless? by practice by practice? You but? Kaunteya Or Kaunteya? Vairagyena by dispassion? f and? is restrained is restrained. Commentary The constant or repeated effort to keep the wandering mind steady by constant meditation on the Lakshya (center? ideal? goal or object of meditation) is Abhyasa or practice.
